articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspecs Workers' Hostel of Pyongyang Textile Mill
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspecs Workers' Hostel of Pyongyang Textile Mill
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, looked round the newly built workers' hostel of Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill.
					 Watching the hostel, he expressed great satisfaction. He said:  "The hostel looks very nice. The place once covered with dust only has undergone a dramatic change. There has sprung up another splendid structure in the era of the Workers' Party of Korea in a matter of 180 odd days. The People's Army helped me keep the promise made with the workers of the textile mill by creditably performing its role as a standard-bearer in the campaign for implementing the idea of the party and defending its policy."
					
					 He looked round various places of the hostel.
					
					 After entering its lobby, he was pleased to see the floor height of the lobby and the corridor fixed as intended by the party and their walls painted with the color liked by women.
					
					 "Not only bedrooms but also library in the hostel have been arranged well to provide the best convenience to boarders so they might not feel any discomfort in their life", he added.
					
					 He praised the soldier-builders for building the public bath to be impeccable and the dining hall like a banquet hall and equipping the kitchen with modern and latest utensils.
					
					 He was pleased to see a paradise-like park outside the hostel where boarders may have good rest, playing amusement and sports games.
					
					 Going round the hostel, he was very pleased and satisfied. He said: "Another behest of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il has been carried out. How greatly pleased they would have been if they had seen the newly built hostel as they attached so great importance to the textile mill directly linked to the people's living in their lifetime." 
					
					 Officials told him that the employees of the textile mill call the hostel a palace of workers, a hotel of workers and that they hardly find proper words to express thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un.    Hearing this, he said what he just hoped is to see them increase the production of fabrics, remembering Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who made so much effort to provide the people with quality clothing materials.
					
					 Proposing holding a grand banquet for workers in celebration of May Day at the newly built workers' hostel of Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, he asked the director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA to attend the banquet and congratulate the workers on his behalf.
					
					 Kim Jong Un noted: "Through the construction of the hostel the KPA correctly carried out the party's policy and service personnel created again a world-startling miracle under the slogan 'Let us take charge of both national defence and socialist construction!'"
					
					 He said that he was informed every day of the drive waged by them, erecting another building over the hostel and working inside it under the conditions of cold winter. "Even biting cold could not freeze the service personnel whose hearts were burning with the resolution to implement the order of the party," he added.
					
					 Calling on the whole country to learn  the revolutionary soldier spirit and work style of the KPA, he highly praised service personnel of KPA units 966, 462, 101 and 489 for performing feats in devotedly implementing the order of the party and gave them thanks of the supreme commander of the KPA.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Pak Yong Sik and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Tok Hun Appointed as Vice-Premier
articles.content:
Kim Tok Hun Appointed as Vice-Premier
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Tok Hun was appointed as vice-premier of the DPRK, according to a decree promulgated by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian Deputy PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian Deputy PM
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Yuri Trutnev wished the DPRK prosperity, expressing the expectation that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Gift from Russian Deputy PM
articles.content:
Gift from Russian Deputy PM
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Yuri Trutnev conveyed the gift to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Russian Deputy PM Leaves
articles.content:
Russian Deputy PM Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Yuri Trutnev, deputy prime minister and presidential envoy to the Far East Federal District of the Russian Federation, left here for home on Wednesday.
					 Also leaving with him were Vladimir Mikulushevski, governor of the Maritime Territory Administration of the Russian Federation, Governor of Amur Region Oleg Kozhemyako and Byacheslav Shport, governor of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Netherlands
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Netherlands
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Willem Alexander, king of the Kingdom of Netherlands, on its national day.
					 The message extended congratulations to the king and the people of the Netherlands and wished the country development and prosperity.

articles.title: Chairman of C.C., Workers' Party of Bangladesh Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
Chairman of C.C., Workers' Party of Bangladesh Meets WPK Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh (WPB), had a talk with a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, on April 24. The WPK delegation visited Bangladesh to participate in the 9th Congress of the WPB.
					 Recollecting with deep emotion the time when he was honored with the audience of President Kim Il Sung during his visit to the DPRK, Rashed Khan Menon said he would always remember that day of glory.
					
					 He went on saying:
					
					 The DPRK turned into an invincible country with the strong national power under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK has successfully settled the issue of succession of the leadership as it is having Marshal Kim Jong Un at the head of the party, state and army.
					
					 The DPRK where socialism is winning victory after victory is greatly encouraging the progressive political parties and people of the world.
					
					 The Workers' Party and people of Bangladesh are fully supporting the just cause of the WPK and the Korean people, the chairman said, expressing belief that the Korean people would achieve greater successes in their struggle to build a thriving socialist country and reunify the country under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Mohammad Nasim, member of the Standing Committee of the Central Committee of the Awami League of Bangladesh, Dilip Barua, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), and Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, respectively met and had conversations with the WPK delegation.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Pulling up DPRK over Old Cultural Treasures
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Pulling up DPRK over Old Cultural Treasures
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued information bulletin No. 1060 on Wednesday blasting the south Korean authorities for pulling up the DPRK over the cultural treasures dating back to the Korean Feudal Dynasty recently returned by Obama.
					 The bulletin said:
					
					 During his recent south Korean junket Obama, under the strong pressure by the south Korean people, staged the farce of returning to south Korea nine pieces of cultural treasures including the state seal dating back to the Korean Feudal Dynasty looted by the U.S. imperialist forces of aggression during the past Korean war.
					
					 As far as those treasures are concerned, they were looted by an officer of the U.S. Marines from the Deogsu Palace in Seoul and hidden inside his stockings before being taken away to the U.S.
					
					 Nevertheless, Chongwadae of south Korea groundlessly claimed that those treasures had been "looted by north Korea" during the war. 
					
					 This is another cynical ploy to cover up the criminal atrocities committed by the U.S. and do harm to compatriots in the north, another provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 Even the top boss of American masters admitted that they were taken away by the U.S. It is, however, only Chongwadae which is floating the "story about the plunder of treasures by the north". This proves that the Park Geun Hye group is hordes of despicable sycophants and traitors and maniacs hell-bent on confrontation with their fellow countrymen. 
					
					 It is quite natural that the south Korean people are cursing Park, daughter of "yusin" dictator, as "a murderer" and shouting the slogan "Haya" (Park step down) as she is refusing to make any proper apology for the death of hundreds of innocent people including young schoolchildren and shifting the responsibility for it onto her inferiors while going busy kissing outside forces.
					
					 Park Geun Hye will not be able to evade a severe punishment by history for her thrice-cursed crimes.

articles.title: WAF President Leaves
articles.content:
WAF President Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Ugur Erdener, president of the World Archery Federation, left here Wednesday.

articles.title: Chinese Friendship Visiting Group Goes Back
articles.content:
Chinese Friendship Visiting Group Goes Back
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The friendship visiting group of the China National Tourism Administration led by Vice-Chairman Du Yili went back Wednesday.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Youth League in Japan Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Youth League in Japan Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Korean Youth League in Japan headed by its Vice-Chairman Kim Tu Sop on a visit to the socialist homeland visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them on Wednesday.
					 Members of the delegation laid bouquets before the statues and bowed to them.
					
					 The delegation arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Meeting of Silkworm-Raising Activists of Women's Union Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Silkworm-Raising Activists of Women's Union Held
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of silkworm-raising activists of the women's union took place here Wednesday.
					 The women's union organizations and members across the country have raised many silkworms since the building of a new country, produced lots of cocoons and contributed to improving the people's living standard and building a rich and powerful country.
					
					 They created thousands of hectares of mulberry fields and increased the cocoon production by widely introducing scientific and technological achievements. In this course many units became model primary organizations and model primary committees.
					
					 The meeting discussed tasks and ways facing the women's union organizations in contributing to improving the people's living standard through a more dynamic silkworm-raising campaign. 
					
					 Present there were officials of the women's union, officials concerned and women's union members who set an example in raising silkworms.
					
					 A report made by Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the C.C., the women's union, was followed by speeches.

articles.title: Socialist Emulation for Increased Production Called for
articles.content:
Socialist Emulation for Increased Production Called for
 Kangso, April 30 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers of Kangso District, Nampho City at a meeting at the Chongsan Co-op Farm on Wednesday called upon the whole country to conduct the socialist emulation for increased production to finish the rice-transplanting qualitatively at the right season this year.
					 A reporter and speakers at the meeting stressed the need to finish rice-transplanting qualitatively at the right season, bearing in mind that rice-transplanting is an important farming process deciding the success in the year's farming.
					
					 They underlined the need for farms in the district to raise a hot wind for emulation by effectively conducting the socialist emulation for increased production among cooperative farms, workteams, sub-workteams and work groups.
					
					 Released at the meeting was the outline of socialist emulation for increased production.
					
					 Present there were Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, officials concerned, officials of the union and agricultural workers in Kangso District.

articles.title: Exhibition on Education of Gifted Students and Public Presentation Held
articles.content:
Exhibition on Education of Gifted Students and Public Presentation Held
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of successes made in the education of gifted students and public presentation of its experience took place between April 28 and 30 on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's field guidance to Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1.
					 Exhibited there were more than 900 achievements made in education conducive to improving the contents of education of gifted students and its method. Experience gained by exemplary teachers was presented.
					
					 Highly appreciated were successes and experience gained in the education by Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1, Changdok School, Kim Jong Suk Secondary School No. 1, Moranbong Secondary School No.1, East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1, Sinuiju Secondary School No. 1, Sariwon Secondary School No. 1, Hamhung Secondary School No. 1, Chongjin Secondary School No. 1 and Wonsan Secondary School No. 1 and experimental apparatuses and teaching materials presented by the schools.
					
					 Exhibits including 3-D geometry model, device for measuring speed of chemical reaction, physical optical instrument and simulation program for chemical experiment and reaction calculation were appreciated by the participants.

articles.title: Anniversary of Publication of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Publication of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- A national symposium on medical science was held here on Tuesday and Wednesday to mark the 40th anniversary of the publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Further Improving the Public Health Service".
					 The work, published on April 9, Juche 63 (1974), comprehensively deals with matters arising in bringing about a signal turn in the public health service by applying the original idea of President Kim Il Sung on the public health.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned and medical officials, scientists, technicians, teachers and postgraduates in the sector of the public health. The symposium was held, divided into such panels as internal medicine, external medicine, Koryo medicine, sanitary and anti-epidemic medicine, basic medicine and pharmacology.
					
					 Published there were more than 400 medical science papers.
					
					 The participants heard successes made in diagnosing and treating various diseases through laboratory and clinical studies in recent years and experience gained in putting the preventive treatment on a modern and scientific basis as required by the IT age and further rounding off the telemedicine system.
					
					 Papers issued by 27 persons were estimated for their great practical significance. They included Nam Hye Yong, Han Kwang Hyok, teachers of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Pak Hwi Myong, postgraduate of the college, Choe Kon Il, doctor of Kim Man Yu Hospital, Pyo Hae Nyong, researcher of the medical instrument institute of the Academy of Medical Science, and Paek Un Jong, doctor of the National Hygienic and Anti-epidemic Center of the Ministry of Public Health.

articles.title: Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest Closes
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest Closes
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest closed with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Wednesday. It opened on April 1 on the occasion the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 In the basketball games men of the April 25 Sports Team and women of the Amnokgang Sports Team won the first place, men of the Kigwancha Sports Team and women of the April 25 Sports Team came second and men of the Sobaeksu Sports Team and women of the Kigwancha Sports Team third.
					
					 In the volleyball games men and women of the April 25 Sports Team placed the first, men of the Amnokgang Sports Team and women of the Pyongyang Sports Team the second and men and women of the Sobaeksu Sports Team the third.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned and those in the sports field and sportspersons.

articles.title: Medicinal Herb Cultivation Encouraged in DPRK
articles.content:
Medicinal Herb Cultivation Encouraged in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Medicinal herb cultivation is gaining momentum in the DPRK in April and May.
					 Hundreds of thousands of different saplings are growing in more than 150 nurseries and over 1,500 hectares of land have been registered as cultivation area.
					
					 More than 880 hectares of land have been reclaimed for herb cultivation in Taedong, Mundok and Songchon counties in South Phyongan Province while over 700 hectares of herb garden are under cultivation in Pyoksong, Kangryong, Ongjin and Samchon counties in South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 Koryo medicine pharmaceutical factories and herb farms in North Phyongan Province have paid deep attention to raising varieties of medical plants.
					
					 In the meantime, gathering of mature herbs has been pushed forward throughout the country.

articles.title: Wave of Creative Speeds Witnessed in DPRK
articles.content:
Wave of Creative Speeds Witnessed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Over the past years the DPRK has made long strides, creating the world-startling speeds of advance one after another.
					 Its people built the war-torn country into a socialist industrial state with the Pyongyang Speed, Vinalon Speed and Chollima Speed that helped work admirable miracles and innovations in construction and production.
					
					 The 80's Speed Movement was launched in the 1980s, resulting in emergence of the West Sea Barrage, called a miracle in the 20th century, and a period of prosperity in the construction of Pyongyang.
					
					 In the 1990s, the DPRK overcame the hardships, caused by the imperialists' unprecedented isolation moves, and paved a way for building a thriving nation by creating unusual advance speeds.
					
					 Then followed the Huichon Speed and the Masikryong Speed whereby the Korean people put the local machinery factories on a CNC basis in a little more than 10 years and soldier-builders built a world-leading ski resort in more than one and a half year.
					
					 When touring the construction site of gasification process at the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex in March Juche 100 (2011), leader Kim Jong Il appreciated its builders for having completed the construction in the main in one and a half year and stressed that it was another miracle to be recorded in the history of construction. This is a new Chollima Speed, the speed of Korea that makes one hundred or one thousand steps forward while others take one or ten steps, he added.
					
					 The recent one year witnessed one more speed of advance in the DPRK, which ushered in the heyday of construction in the country.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un visited the January 8 Fishery Station of the Korean People's Army, which was built in a matter of two months after he initiated its construction, and called it a display of Korea Speed.
					
					 The advance speeds created by the Korean people prove that the DPRK does what it is determined to do.

articles.title: Kaesong City Featured by Gingko Trees
articles.content:
Kaesong City Featured by Gingko Trees
 Kaesong, April 30 (KCNA) -- Gingko trees growing on both sides of streets in Kaesong City add to the scenic beauty of the time-honored cultural city.
					 These trees make passers-by in the city particularly pleasant.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, while providing field guidance to Kaesong City on September 14, Juche 61 (1972), gave an instruction to plant a lot of those trees along the streets of the city.
					
					 The city successfully built a nursery of gingko saplings to mass-produce them.
					
					 Trees in Namdaemun crossroads, Pojon, Yokjon, Sungjon and Unhak streets and other streets in the center of the city were replaced by gingko trees.
					
					 This year, the city built the streets between the City People's Hospital and Tongdaemun and between the Youth Park and Cinema on an expansion basis and planted gingko trees along them.

articles.title: History: Plunder of Korea's Forest by Japan
articles.content:
History: Plunder of Korea's Forest by Japan
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- During its colonial rule over Korea, Japan had robed it of rich forest resources at random.
					 The Japanese imperialists enforced an "Ordinance on Forest" to loot forests in Korea under the pretext of "nationalization". And they proclaimed a "Forest Survey Act" on May 1, 1918, allegedly to finally confirm Korea's ownership of forest.
					
					 The act was an evil law invented to tighten Japan's colonial rule over Korea and plunder it of all the forest resources. 
					
					 Under this act, the Japanese imperialists set about the planned and indiscriminate deforestation in Korea.
					
					 They made 13 millions of 16 million hectares of forest Japan's property in the plea of "nationalized forest", while the rest was distributed to Japanese landlords and pro-Japanese elements.
					
					 30 million cubic meters of timber had been shipped from Korea for Japan between 1931 and 1942, thus leaving the dense forests along the shores of Amnok and Tuman rivers depleted. 
					
					 Later, the Japanese imperialists seized all the forests in Korea under the pretext of surveying and registering the ownership of forests and economic conditions. 
					
					 Such illegal plunder is still in the memory of the Korean people, who will surely force Japan to pay dearly for its crimes.

articles.title: News Analysis on Poor Human Rights Records in US
articles.content:
News Analysis on Poor Human Rights Records in US
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the United States had a ceremony to mark the 50th anniversary of the institution of citizenship act in the presence of President Obama.
					 As the world's worst human rights abuser, it pretended to be a "model" in human rights performance. More ridiculous are Obama's remarks at the ceremony that as the president, he came to realize that it is hard to make progress in the American society and there are some discouraging points.
					
					 In fact, the remarks are little different from his admission of the serious human rights situation in the U.S.
					
					 Under the citizenship act, racialism is getting more severe in the U.S. The gaps between the minorities and the whites are very wide in the exercise of such rights to work and elect. The U.S. true colors as a kingdom of racial discrimination was fully revealed by last year's case that the Florida Court gave a verdict of not guilty to a white policeman who shot to death an innocent black boy.
					
					 That's why 52 percent of the Americans have said that racism still exists in the country while 46 percent contended that all sorts of discrimination would be everlasting.
					
					 The U.S. is a living hell as elementary rights to existence are ruthlessly violated.
					
					 At present, an average of 300,000 people a week are registered as unemployed, but any proper measure has not been taken.
					
					 The housing price soared 11.5 percent last year than 2012 and 13.2 percent in January this year than 2013, leaving many people homeless.
					
					 The number of impoverished people increased to 46.5 millions last year, and one sixth of the citizens and 20-odd percent of the children are in the grip of famine in New York City.
					
					 All sorts of crimes rampant in the U.S. pose a serious threat to the people's rights to existence and their inviolable rights. 
					
					 The U.S. government has monitored every movement of its citizens and foreigners, with many cameras and tapping devices and even drones involved, under the pretext of "national security".
					
					 Meanwhile, bills on easing arms control were adopted in various states of the country, boosting murderous crimes. As a result, the U.S. has witnessed an increasing number of gun-related crimes in all parts of the country and even its military bases this year. In this regard, the United Nations on April 10 put the U.S. on the top of the world list of homicide rates.
					
					 The U.S. also has 2.2 millions of prisoners at present, the highest number in the world. For lack of prisons on the part of the government, individuals are providing detention facilities to make money.
					
					 A Russian TV said that in the U.S. the wealthy classes are now keen on the investment in providing private prisons for their high profit and so more people will be imprisoned.
					
					 Such poor human right records in the U.S. are an inevitable product of the ruling quarters' policy against humanity.
					
					 Its chief executive, Obama, indulges himself in luxury almost every day, squandering hundred millions of dollars on his foreign trip in disregard of his people's wretched life.
					
					 It is also the president who called for respect to the verdict of not guilty given to a white policeman's racialism and backed the unlawful monitoring and tapping activities.
					
					 The U.S. is the world's worst human right abuser and tundra of a human being's rights to existence.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Regime Termed Chief Culprit of Ferry Sinking
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Regime Termed Chief Culprit of Ferry Sinking
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea in a special statement on April 26 branded Park Geun Hye as a chief culprit of the tragic sinking of ferry "Sewol".
					 Mounting high is the people's grudge against the incompetent Park regime which failed to rescue children aboard the ferry in distress, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The regime was busy giving wide publicity to the rescue operation but failed to conduct an underwater rescue operation at a critical time for the rescue of survivors.
					
					 The authorities were not concerned about rescuing people from the beginning.
					
					 In the final analysis, the Park regime was to blame for the death of children.
					
					 Clear now is the reason why families of those who went missing insisted on walking  to Chongwadae from Jin Island, South Jolla Province, chanting slogans "Government is killer!" "Bring back our children to life!".
					
					  Murderers must be punished and Park has to own all responsibilities, the statement urged.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Attitude toward Ferry Sinking Case Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Attitude toward Ferry Sinking Case Denounced
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Federation for Economic Justice of south Korea in a statement on Monday denounced the puppet authorities' attitude towards the ferry sinking case, according to a south Korean internet newspaper.
					 The people are becoming increasingly critical of the "government" for failing to conduct a timely operation to rescue the ferry "Sewol", the statement held.
					
					 Park Geun Hye is shifting the responsibility for the sinking on to public officials and crewmen, in particular, they said.
					
					 She is seriously mistaken if she thinks the "government" has fulfilled its responsibility through the "prime minister's" expression of his intention to step down, the statement said, urging her to make a direct apology to the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Misrule under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Misrule under Fire 
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Organizations of people of various circles in south Korea including the Group of Joint Struggle for Termination of Discrimination against the Disabled Persons held a meeting in Seoul to denounce the misrule of the puppet authorities on April 20.
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The resolution said that a disabled person died on April 17 without receiving any support to living due to the authorities' discriminating policy.
					
					 The south Korean society is a society of brutes which drives the disabled and poor to death, the resolution noted, and went on:
					
					 The authorities should make a prompt apology for the discrimination and take a step to prevent the recurrence of the tragedy.
					
					 The resolution declared that the participants would carry on their actions till their demands are met.
					
					 They took to the street at the end of the meeting.

articles.title: US and S. Korean War Drills under Fire
articles.content:
US and S. Korean War Drills under Fire
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany posted on its website an article disclosing the true colors of the U.S. and south Korean puppet group escalating the tension on the Korean peninsula on April 24.
					 The article noted that the Korean peninsula is now exposed to the danger of a war and the situation in Northeast Asia remains very complicated.
					
					 It accused the U.S. of forming an alliance with Japan and south Korea to hold hegemony in Northeast Asia.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The recent Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills brought a whirlwind of a war to the peninsula and pushed the situation to an extreme phase.
					
					 Such madcap war exercises staged every year under the simulated conditions of a real war did great harm to the south-north relations and put them into a catastrophe.
					
					 The U.S. is persisting in those dangerous war drills fraught with the danger of a nuclear war in their purpose, nature and scale though it is cutting down the scale of military exercises in other parts of the world. 
					
					 The U.S. military doctrine is a preemptive strike and the scenario of the U.S. and south Korea for invading the DPRK is one of a nuclear war.
					
					 The U.S.-south Korean war exercises are the root cause of escalating the tension on the peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised in Guinea, Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised in Guinea, Nepal
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- A radio of Guinea and a Nepalese TV broadcasted special programs on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Guinean domestic and international radios on April 15 broadcasted under the title "Eternal sun":
					
					 Kim Il Sung, who embarked on the road of revolution in his early years and founded the great guiding idea of the cause of independence, is being praised by progressive humankind as the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 He pioneered and led the cause of independence to victory through his original Songun revolutionary leadership and opened up a new era of the development of the international relations on the basis of independence.
					
					 He met over 70,000 foreigners including heads of party, state and government of 136 countries in his lifetime and rendered material and moral assistance to many countries of the world in their struggle for the national liberation, anti-imperialist struggle and building of a new society.
					
					 He is always alive in the hearts of humankind as the sun.
					
					 The Sakirmata TV Broadcasting Service of Nepal on April 15 introduced Kim Il Sung's revolutionary life and exploits for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence, saying that the President who built a socialist power is the eternal sun of all people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Syrian Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Syrian Media
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Syrian media carried special write-ups on April 14 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun).
					 The Syrian newspaper Al Thawrah said in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, history shining with Songun leadership":
					
					 The life of Kim Il Sung, the prominent man of the world political circles in the 20th century, is shining by his Songun leadership.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea and the Songun idea and pioneered the cause of independence by arms.
					
					 Another paper Al Baath said in an article titled "Cause of global independence and President Kim Il Sung" that the exploits he performed for the cause of global independence will shine forever.
					
					 The Syria TV Channel aired a special program on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, introducing in detail the exploits of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il with videos dealing with their revolutionary activities.
					
					 The Central Radio of Syria broadcasted a special program under the title of "On the occasion of the birth anniversary of HE President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people".

articles.title: Korean Film Shows Held in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Korean Film Shows Held in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows took place in foreign countries between April 7 and 14 to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The shows were held by the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, Bukil Mulia Jaya Company of Indonesia, Mariners' Ship and Commerce Co., Universal Surveying Co. and a company of Thailand and the Ministry of Labor in Zamfara State of Nigeria, hospitals in the State, the Ministry of Land Survey in Yobe State and a Koryo medical center in Nigeria. 
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "The Arch of Triumph", "Pyongyang Today" and "Four Seasons in Pyongyang". 
					
					 A secretary of the Secretariat of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle said he was pleased to hold the film show on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, adding that Kimilsungia, immortal flower, came into being in the world thanks to ardent reverence of President Sukarno and world progressives for the great man. 
					
					 A department director of the Ministry of Labor in Zamfara State of Nigeria said that it is the natural disposition of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un in the DPRK to believe in the people as in Heaven. The director expressed envy at the Korean people holding in high esteem the benevolent leaders generation after generation. 
					
					 A department director of the Ministry of Land Survey in Yobe State of Nigeria noted: The august name of Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, means the sun. His august name is shining as the sun.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Events took place in foreign countries between April 12 and 21 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun) and the 82nd founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 They included a joint seminar and book exhibition in Britain, a lecture and film show in Guinea and round-table talks in Ethiopia.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were works of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and other Korean books.
					
					 A professor of the University of London said that Kim Il Sung is the father of socialist Korea and genius of revolution and construction as he brought about the fundamental turn in carving out the destiny of the country and nation under the unfurled banner of Juche and Songun and made the Korean people become the most dignified and happiest people.
					
					 The secretary general of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea praised Kim Il Sung for setting forth the outstanding idea and theories, strategy and tactics on the cause of global independence and making immortal contributions to developing the friendly and cooperative relations among countries desirous of independence.
					
					 The dean of the art faculty of the Guinean Art College said that the heroic Korean People's Army led by Marshal Kim Jong Un, another illustrious brilliant commander, is preventing a new war on the Korean peninsula and reliably guaranteeing the regional peace and security.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Britain.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in UK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in UK
 Pyongyang, April 30 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Bring About Innovations in Agricultural Production under the Unfurled Banner of the Socialist Rural Theses" was published in booklet by the New Communist Party of Britain on April 23. The work is the letter sent by him to the participants in the national conference of subworkteam leaders in the agricultural sector on February 6, Juche 103 (2014). 
					 The work deals with the sea changes brought about in the socialist rural construction in the DPRK since the publication of the Theses on the Socialist Rural Question (Feb. 25, 1964). It indicates the tasks and ways for finally settling the rural question.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre albergue de obreras de Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre albergue de obreras de Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 30 de abril (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el albergue de obreras de la Fabrica Textil Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang recien construido.
					Contemplando el albergue, el Mariscal mostro gran satisfaccion diciendo que el edificio es muy vistoso y se ha levantado en el lugar polvoriento como otra creacion enorgullecedora de la epoca del partido del trabajo durante mas de 180 dias, y que al cumplir con su deber como abanderado en la materializacion de la idea del partido y en la defensa de la politica del partido, el EPC le ayudo a cumplir la promesa del Comandante Supremo hecha con las obreras de la fabrica.
					
					El Mariscal paso revista a varios lugares del albergue.
					
					En el vestibulo, el Mariscal senalo que la altura del entrepiso del hall y los pasillos se establecieron conforme a la demanda del partido y que el color de pared fue seleccionado segun el gusto de las mujeres.
					
					Prosiguio que se acondicionaron excelentemente no solo las habitaciones sino la biblioteca para que las internas no se sientan ninguna incomodidad y se les aseguren la maxima comodidad.
					
					Evaluo que se construyo perfectamente el bano publico, se parece el comedor como una sala de recepcion y son modernos y de ultima moda los utensilios de cocina.
					
					Al ver el parque acondicionado para el descanso, el recreo y el deporte de las internas, se alegro mucho destacando que el parque se parece como un paraiso.
					
					Recorriendo el albergue, el Mariscal mostro su alegria y satisfaccion diciendo que asi se llevo a la realidad otro legado del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y  si hubieran visto el nuevo albergue, se habrian alegrado mucho esos grandes hombres, quienes durante su vida dieron la importancia a esta fabrica relacionada con el problema de vida del  pueblo.
					
					A los funcionarios que le decian que las empleadas de la fabrica llaman el albergue como palacio y hotel de trabajadoras y que no saben como dar el saludo de agradecimiento, el Mariscal dijo que el mismo sentira alegria si ellos producen muchas telas pensando en el Presidente y el Dirigente quienes se esforzaron mucho por entregar al pueblo las telas de buena calidad.
					
					Ofrezcamos solemnemente en este nuevo albergue una recepcion dedicada al Primero de Mayo, acoto e instruyo al jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC a participar en el banquete para felicitar a las trabajadoras entregandolas tambien su alma.
					
					A traves de la construccion del albergue, el EPC materializo correctamente la orientacion del partido y que los constructores militares han creado otro milagro asombroso al levantar en alto la consigna "Encarguemonos tanto de la defensa de la patria como de la construccion del socialismo", recalco.
					
					He recibido diariamente las informaciones de que en la estacion invernal los constructores militares construyeron un edificio exterior y continuaron la obra en ello, acoto y prosiguio que ni el frio intenso pudo congelar el corazon de los militares levantados en materializar la orden del partido.
					
					Senalo que todo el pais debe aprender el espiritu revolucionario de los militares y la manera de trabajar del EPC. Y evaluo altamente las proezas de los militares de las unidades 966, 462, 101 y 489 del EPC quienes materializaron cabalmente la orden del partido y les dio el agradecimiento del Comandante Supremo.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Pak Yong Sik y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Yuri Trutnev y su comitiva
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Yuri Trutnev y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 30 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 30 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Yuri Trutnev, vicepremier del gobierno ruso y representante plenipotenciario del presidente de la Federacion Rusa acreditado en el distrito federal del Lejano Oriente y su comitiva quienes le hicieron una visita de cortesia. 
					En la ocasion, tras desear a la RPDC la prosperidad, el visitante expreso la esperanza de que en el futuro tambien, se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a rey de Holanda
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a rey de Holanda 
Pyongyang, 30 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 30 al rey de Holanda, Willem Alexander, con motivo de la fiesta nacional de este pais.
					 El remitente felicita al rey y pueblo de Holanda y desea de todo corazon el desarrollo y la prosperidad de este pais.

articles.title: Lider de partido politico de Bangladesh apoya causa justa del PTC
articles.content:
Lider de partido politico de Bangladesh apoya causa justa del PTC
Pyongyang, 30 de abril (ACNC) -- El presidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Bangladesh, Rashed Khan Menon, departio el dia 24 con la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encabezada por el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Chang Gun, que participa en IX Congreso de la organizacion bengali.
					Al recordar con emocion el encuentro con el Presidente Kim Il Sung durante su visita a Corea, el lider del partido bengali dijo que no puede olvidar jamas ese dia de honor.
					
					Senalo que bajo la sabia direccion del Presidente y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se ha convertido en potencia invencible con formidable poderio nacional.
					
					Enfatizo que gracias a tener al Mariscal Kim Jong Un en el cargo supremo del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, se resolvio perfectamente en Corea el problema de sucesion de la direccion.
					
					Destaco que la realidad de Corea, donde el socialismo sale siempre victorioso, da gran estimulo a los partidos politicos y los pueblos progresistas del mundo.
					
					El Partido del Trabajo y el pueblo de Bangladesh apoyan totalmente la justa causa del PTC y el pueblo coreano, dijo y expreso la conviccion de que bajo la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, el pueblo coreano lograra mayores exitos en la lucha por construir un Estado prospero socialista y reunificar el pais.
					
					Por otra parte, el miembro del comite permanente del CC de la Liga Awami, Mohammad Nasim, el secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Comunista (Marxista-Leninista), Dilip Barua y el presidente de la Liga Popular de Bangladesh, Garib Newaz, se reunieron por separado con la delegacion del PTC.
